title: Command to mount SMB folder error out due to a wrongly placed linebreak
body:
### Vagrant version
Vagrant 1.9.5

### Host operating system
Windows 10

### Guest operating system
Alpine Linux 3.6

### Vagrantfile
```ruby
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  config.vm.box = "maier/alpine-3.6-x86_64"
  config.vm.synced_folder ".", "/vagrant", type: 'smb'
end
```

### Debug output
```
Failed to mount folders in Linux guest. This is usually because
the "vboxsf" file system is not available. Please verify that
the guest additions are properly installed in the guest and
can work properly. The command attempted was:

mount -t cifs -o uid=1000,gid=1000
,sec=ntlm,credentials=/etc/smb_creds_83efd3a5d64c5403387804288863b822 //172.16.0.103/83efd3a5d64c5403387804288863b822 /vagrant

The error output from the last command was:

bash: line 5: ,sec=ntlm,credentials=/etc/smb_creds_83efd3a5d64c5403387804288863b822: No such file or directory
```

A complete copy is at [here](https://gist.github.com/louy2/4a726bfae92367246f94553ce5d53c48), in which I have redacted my credential.

### Expected behavior
Use the command 

```
mount -t cifs -o uid=1000,gid=1000,sec=ntlm,credentials=/etc/smb_creds_83efd3a5d64c5403387804288863b822 //172.16.0.103/83efd3a5d64c5403387804288863b822 /vagrant
```

to mount folder.

### Actual behavior
The command

```
mount -t cifs -o uid=1000,gid=1000
,sec=ntlm,credentials=/etc/smb_creds_83efd3a5d64c5403387804288863b822 //172.16.0.103/83efd3a5d64c5403387804288863b822 /vagrant
```

is used. It has an additional space between `gid` and `sec`, making 

    ,sec=ntlm,credentials=/etc/smb_creds_83efd3a5d64c5403387804288863b822

instead of 

    //172.16.0.103/83efd3a5d64c5403387804288863b822

the path to mount, resulting in `No such file or directory`.

### Steps to reproduce
1. `vagrant up --provision`

### References
#8665
